metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1625 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An information leak was discovered in OpenStack heat. This issue could allow a remote, authenticated attacker to use the 'stack show' command to reveal parameters which are supposed to remain hidden. This has a low impact to the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the system.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1625` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

heat-api - 1:10.0.2-0ubuntu1.1
heat-api-cfn - 1:10.0.2-0ubuntu1.1
heat-common - 1:10.0.2-0ubuntu1.1
heat-engine - 1:10.0.2-0ubuntu1.1
python-heat - 1:10.0.2-0ubuntu1.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> fixed in jammy-updates and kinetic-updates as a SRU, but not yet in the -security pocket.

criterions.comment: heat package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:10.0.2-0ubuntu1.1').
